did.head: COLLECTION SUMMARY

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of KansasKenneth Spencer Research Library Kansas Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Douglass Hospital (Kansas City, Kan.) Training School

did.abstract: The Douglass Hospital Training School records are those of the Douglass Hospital school for nurses in Kansas City, Kansas.

bioghist.head: HISTORY of Douglass Hospital Training School
bioghist.p: The Douglass Hospital Training School, Kansas City, Kansas began in 1898. The School offered two courses of study: a two year course for registered nurses and a one year course for hospital workers and practical nurses. In 1915, the School began a long term affiliation with Western University. A number of the School's graduates went on the Western as teachers or to continue their education.

scopecontent.head: SCOPE and CONTENTS
scopecontent.p: The Douglass Hospital Training School records date from 1927 to 1989 and consist of a brief school history and several snapshots. Photographs from the collection are located at RH MS-P P681.
